Name: Is there a distinct category of dual for verbal agreement with a dual subject?
Is non-agreement in number between the nominal subject and verbal predicate possible?
Comment: In 3Pl forms, the impersonal form is used.

Name: Can finite verbs agree in number with the nominal object?
Can an adnominal property word agree with the noun in case?
Are there cases that do not show agreement in terms of case?
Can adpositions be used to mark core verbal arguments?
Can adpositions be used to mark non-core/oblique verbal arguments?
Can non-finite clauses entail a special way for a core argument (S/A) marking?
Example: Tuato-n tullešša kodi-h;father-GEN come.CVB home-ILL;When father came home...;

Name: Can non-finite clauses entail a special way for a core argument (P) marking?
Do characteristics of object referent (topicality, animacy, definiteness) influence object marking?
Does object marking correlate with aspectuality?
Example: Mie luve-n tä-dä kniiguoi;I read-1SG this-PRT book.PRT;I am reading this book;|Mie luv-i-n tämä-n kniiga-n;I read-PST-1SG this-GEN book-GEN;I read this book;

Name: Does the marking of the object depend on the verb conjugation form?
Example: Luve tämä kniiga!;read.IMP.2SG this.NOM book.NOM;Read this book!;

Name: Is there differential subject marking?
Example: Stola-lla on leibiä;table-ADE  be.3SG bread.PRT;There is some bread on the table;|Leibä on magie;bread.NOM be.3SG sweet;The bread is sweet;

Name: Can S and A be conflated morphologically across clause boundaries, i.e. act as syntactic pivot?
Example: hüö otettih kartohka-t i kuattih karžinah;they take-IPS.PST potato-PL and pour-IPS.PST basket-ILL;They took the potatoes and poured it into the basket;

Name: Can S and P be conflated morphologically across clause boundaries, i.e. act as syntactic pivot?
Is there a grammatical device for habituality?
Is there a grammatical device for frequentative?
Example: lendöy;fly.3SG;s/he is flying;|lendelöy;fly.FRQ.3SG around;s/he is flying around

Name: Is there a grammatical device for progressivity?
Is it common to use a verb in the present tense for future time reference?
Example: Mie ošša-n leibiä huomena;I buy-PRS.1SG bread.PRT tomorrow;I'll buy (some) bread tomorrow;

Name: Is there a grammatical device for immediate future?
Is there a grammatical device for pluperfect?
Comment: Nowadays only the imperfect is used.

Name: Can aspect be expressed overtly on the negative marker?
Can tense be expressed overtly on the negative marker?
Comment: The negation is formed using a negative particle.

Name: Is there grammatical marking of mirativity?
Is there morphological marking on the verb dedicated to the expression of desire or wish?
Is there morphological marking for irrealis (e.g. hypothetical state of affairs)?
Example: Mie kaččo-zi-n tä-dä fil´mu-a;I watch-COND-1SG this-PRT movie-PRT;I would watch this movie;

Name: Are verbs marked in a specific mood in counterfactual conditional clauses?
Example: Mie oli-zi-n tul-lun šiu-n luokši, kuin oli-zi-n ol-lun linna-šša;I be-COND-1SG come-ACT.PST.PTCP you-GEN to if be-COND-1SG be-ACT.PST.PTCP town-INE;I would have come to your place if I would have been in town;

Name: Is there morphological marking on the verb dedicated to the expression of deontic necessity?
Is there morphological marking on the verb dedicated to the expression of epistemic possibility?
Example: Hiän anda-nnou šiu-la hyvä-n neuvo-n;s/he give-POT.3SG you-ADE/ALL good-GEN advice-GEN;S/he might give you good advice;

Name: Is there morphological marking on the verb dedicated to the expression of deontic possibility?
Is there morphological marking on the verb used to express indirect commands/wishes etc. directed to the 3Sg?
Example: Tul-gah hiän huomena;come-JUSS.3SG s/he tomorrow;Let him/her come tomorrow;
Comment: The analytic formation is, however, more common: Ana hiän tulou huomena (give.IMP.2G s/he come.3SG tomorrow) 'Let him/her come tomorrow'.

Name: Is there morphological marking on the verb used to express indirect commands/wishes etc. directed to the 1Sg?
Comment: Ana hiän tulou huomena

Name: Is it common to use the imperative/jussive in complement clauses introduced by predicates expressing wish/desire/will?
Comment: give.IMP.2G s/he come.3SG tomorrow

Name: Is there morphological marking on the verb dedicated to the expression of apprehension?
Comment: 'Let him/her come tomorrow'

Name: Is there reflexive conjugation?
Are there syntactically ditransitive verbs?
Can non-singular 2nd and 3rd person have the same person/number marking or morphosyntactic treatment?
Can an impersonal (or passive) form be used instead of a finite plural form with an overt subject expression?
Example: Vanhemmat ele-täh kylä-ššä;partents live-IPS.PRS village-INE;The parents are living in a village;

Name: Can third person plural verb forms be used for impersonal reference?
Can second person singular verb forms be used in generic meaning?
Example: Mua-lla elä-t mua-n tavalla;land-ADE live-2SG land-GEN according;In a land one lives according to the land's customs;

Name: Are clauses with only infinitive predicates possible?
Can verbs in purposive subordinate clauses be in bare infinitive form?
Example: Tul-i-n tänne opaštu-mah;come-PST-1SG here study-SUP;I came here to study;

Name: Are there sentences without overt verbal arguments (e.g. weather verbs)?
Is copula needed for predicate nominals in the 3rd person form of the present tense?
Comment: Nowadays it is common to drop the copula, which can be regarded as Russian influence, e.g. Miun muamo (on) opaštaja (I-GEN mother (be.3SG) teacher) 'My mother is a teacher'.

Name: Is a copula needed for predicate nominals in the past and/or future tense?
Example: Miu-n mauamo lieu opaštaja-na;I-GEN mother will_be.3SG teacher.ESS;My mother will be a teacher;

Name: Can locative adverbial phrases act as predicates without a copula?
Can the same coordinating conjunction be used for NPs, VPs, and clauses?
Example: tanhuo-šša i pert´i-s's'ä;barn-INE and house-INE;in the barn and in the house;|otat i tuot;take-2SG and bring-2SG;you take and bring

Name: Does existential negation have a separate operator?
Can standard negation be asymmetric in the present tense?
Example: mie ota-n : mie en ota;I take-1SG  :  I NEG.PRS.1SG take.CNG;I take : I don’t take;

Name: Can non-finite dependent clauses use the standard negation construction?
Is there a special negator that combines with non-finite forms?
Are there special negative non-finite forms?
Is there an impersonal passive construction?
Example: Täššä ele-täh hyvin;here live-IPS.PRS well;Here (people) live well;

Name: Are there nonfinite forms specialized on the relativization of particular core participants, e.g. subjects (S/A), direct objects (P), absolutive participants (S/P)?
Are there nonfinite forms that can relativize at least all core participants (S/A/P) and possibly also some noncore participants, e.g. locative adverbials, instruments, etc.?
Are there nonfinite forms that can relativize at least some noncore participants, e.g. locative adverbials or instruments, but cannot relativize all or some of the core participants, e.g. subjects?
Is there a specialized negative participial form, which cannot be analyzed as a specific participial marker + negation marker?
Is there a future participle?
Are there participles that can encode their subject by possessive suffixes?
Can subject in at least some participial subordinate clauses be encoded in the same way as in independent clauses?
Are there participles that obligatorily agree with the nouns they modify in case and number (in all contexts)?
Example: laule-ttuo-šša virre-ššä;sing-PPP-INE song-INE;in a song that has been sung;

Name: Are there nonfinite forms that can be used both as participles and action nominalizations?
Are there nonfinite forms that can be used both as participles and agentive nominalizations?
Example: opaštu-ja;study-AG.NMLZ;student;|opaštu-ja tyttö;study-AG.NMLZ girl;a girl, who is studying;

Name: Are there nonfinite forms that can be used both as participles and converbs without any additional morphological material, such as case markers?
Is OV the neutral order in affirmative imperative clauses?
Is it possible to place an object between the negative marker and the main verb in imperative constructions?
Are there preverbs?
Are there verbal prefixes?
Is there diminutive (hypocoristic) marking on verbs?
Can modifiers of action nominalization in agent and patient roles both be marked like possessors?
Example: Poja-n pežendä;boy-GEN washing;washing of the boy/washing the boy;

Name: Can the modifier of action nominalization in patient role (e.g. "drinking of coffee") be marked like the direct object?
Example: kirjaze-n kirjutanda;letter-GEN writing;writing a letter;|kirjuta-n kirjas´e-n;write-1SG letter-GEN;I'll write a letter;

Name: Do core adjectives agree with the subject noun in number in the predicative position?
Example: Poja-t ol-lah korgie-t;boy-PL be-IPS.PRS high-PL;The boys are tall;

Name: Is it possible to form synthetic superlative?
Can adpositions have person/number marking?
Are there separate adpositions to express goal, source, and location (without there being syncretism)?
Is case compounding possible?
Are there case categories only found in pronouns?
Comment: The accusative is used  only with pronouns, e.g. miut 'me', miät 'us'.

Name: Does the numeral modification of a noun have an effect on its case selection?
Example: yksi piirua : kakši piirua-da;one pie.NOM.SG : two pie-PRT.SG

Name: Is the singular form of the noun also used with numerals bigger than 1?
Example: yksi piirua : kakši piirua-da;one pie.NOM.SG : two pie-PRT.SG

Name: Is there a genitive case that has an affix?
Is there a dative case used to express indirect object/receiver/goal (different from a local case)?
Is there a terminative case?
Is there a separate case to indicate without what/who an action takes place / does not take place?
Is there a separate case to mark the motion along or by the referent of the noun (prolative)?
Is there a locative case that marks goal?
Comment: Goal and location are marked the same way, e.g. naize-lla woman-ALL/ADE.

Name: Is there a locative case that marks location?
Comment: Goal and location are marked the same way, e.g. naize-lla woman-ALL/ADE.

Name: Is there a locative case that marks source?
Example: Tule-n mečä-štä;come-1SG forest-ELA;I am coming from the forest;

Name: Is there case syncretism of goal and location marking?
Comment: See UT086 and UT87.

Name: Is there case syncretism of location and source marking?
Are there two sets of local cases?
Comment: External and internal local cases are used.

Name: Is there a third set of local cases?
Comment: There are some indications that a third set started to develop but it never fully developed.

Name: Is there a separate case for marking the means by which something is carried out (instrumental) and/or accompaniement (comitative)?
Is there a separate case for marking accompaniment, which is different from the instrumental?
Is there a separate case for marking the result of change (translative) and/or a state of being (essive)?
Example: Mie opaššu-n opaštaja-kši;I learn-1SG teacher-TRA;I am learrning to become a teacher;

Name: Is there a separate case for marking the state of being (essive), which is different from the translative?
Example: Mie rua-n opaštaja-na;I work-1SG teacher-ESS;I am working as a teacher;

Name: Is there a separate morphological marker for expressing equative meaning?
Is there an inflectional nominal marker for expressing benefactive or destinative semantics independent from the dative?
Comment: A postposition is used.

Name: Is there in addition to the basic declension a declension different from a possessive declension?
Is it possible to use singular with paired body parts/clothing/accessories that accompany them?
Can the marking of the possessor in the attributive construction vary?
Can the possessor in the attributive construction be marked with the nominative?
Is non-singular possession marked in the possessive declension?
Can 2Sg possessive suffix be used to mark definiteness?
Can 3Sg possessive suffix be used to mark definiteness?
Is there animacy distinction in independent interrogative pronouns?
When used as a relative pronoun, is it common to use 'who' for animates other than humans?
Example: Koira-t, ke-t ~ kumbaze-d issu-tah; dog-PL who-PL ~ which-PL sit-IPS.PRS
Comment: Still, kumb 'which' is more commonly used.

Name: When used as a relative pronoun, is it common to use 'who' for inanimates?
Can a demonstrative stem be used in the function of a pronoun with 3rd person singular human referent?
Is the order of possessive suffix and case suffix across the paradigm the same?
Example: Mie nä-i-n tuattu-a-ni;I see-PST-1SG father-PRT-POSS.1SG;I saw my father;
Comment: The order is case suffix + possessive suffix.

Name: Is the order of number and case suffixes fixed across the paradigm the same?
Comment: The order is number + case suffix.

Name: Are there different words for mother’s brother and father’s brother?
Are there different words for younger and older relative for other relations than siblings?
Is there animacy distinction for both concepts 'new/young' and 'old'?
Comment: Vanha/vahna 'old' can be used for inanimates as well as animates, however, there is a separate lexeme to denote old people - ruavaš.

Name: Is there distinction for both 'warm' and 'cold' based on whether referring to weather or to temperature of objects?
Is there contrastive length of consonants?
Is there contrastive length of vowels?
Is there contrast between short and long unstressed vowels?
Is there contrast in duration of geminate consonants?
Are there more than two phonological quantities?
Are there extralong syllables?
Is the main foot structure trochaic?
Is there lexically distinctive word stress?
Is there morphologically conditioned stress?
Is there fixed primary stress?
Is there stress in heavy syllables?
Is there non-initial primary stress?
Is there palatal vowel harmony?
Is there velar vowel harmony?
Is there labial vowel harmony?
Are there rising diphthongs?
Are there lowering diphthongs?
Is there qualitative contrast between subsets of short and long vowels?
Are there full vs. reduced vowels as contrastive subsets?
Is there front high rounded vowel ü [y]?
Is there front midhigh rounded vowel ö [ø]?
Is there back high unrounded vowel ï [ɯ]?
Is there back midhigh unrounded vowel ë [ɤ]?
Is there back low round vowel [ɒ]?
Is there contrast between low and mid front vowels (ä [æ] vs. e [e])?
Are there word-initial consonant clusters?
Are there word-internal consonant clusters in syllable onset?
Are there consonant clusters in syllable coda?
Are there clusters of three or more consonants in a word between vowels?
Are there word-final clusters of three or more consonants?
Are there palatalized dentals?
Are there palatalized labials and velars?
Is there palatal stop [c]?
Is there palatal nasal [ɲ]?
Is there palatal lateral [ʎ]?
Is there phonemic velar nasal [ŋ]?
Comment: ŋ is an allophone, e.g. henged [ˈheŋ.ged] 'souls'

Name: Is there dental affricate [t͡s]?
Comment: Only in loanwords, e.g. cuari [ˈt͡sua.ri] 'czar'.

Name: Is there non-alveolar affricate (e.g. [t͡ʃ], [͡cɕ])?
Is there a phonological contrast between [s] and postalveolar sibilant [ʃ]?
Are there voiced plosives [b, g, d]?
Is there glottal stop [ˀ]?
Is there phonological contrast between plain and labial velar consonants (e.g. [k] vs. [kʷ])?
Is there a constraint on word-initial r?
Is there laryngeal fricative [h]?
Is there voiced velar fricative [ɣ]?
Is there voiceless velar fricative [x]?
Is there voiced dental fricative [ð]?
Is there phonemic labio-velar approximant [w]?
Is there voiceless labiodental fricative [f]?
Is there radical qualitative consonant gradation?
Is there quantitative consonant gradation?
